Virtual Machines

Provision Windows and Linux virtual machines in seconds

1RMB Trial Buy Now

We support Virtual Machines of multiple scales. The Virtual Machine permits billing by the minute and listing of pricing by hourly rates. We will charge you by total minutes when the running time of your Virtual Machine is less than 1 hour.

Types of Virtual Machines

  • Windows
  • Linux
  • SQL Server for Windows
  • SQL Server Ubuntu Linux
  • Machine Learning Server
  • General Purpose
  • Compute Optimized
  • Memory Optimized

General purpose: Balanced CPU-to-memory ratio. Ideal for testing and development, small to medium databases, and low to medium traffic web servers.

A0-4 – Basic

The A Series Basic tier provides a cost-effective option for development/testing workloads and other applications not requiring load balancing, autoscaling or memory-intensive Virtual Machines.

F series/FS series

The F Series/FS Series Virtual Machine supports RAM of every CPU core 2 GiB and 16 GiB local solid state disk (SSD), and has been prioritized for computing-intensive workloads. The F Series/FS Series are based on the 2.4 GHz Intel Xeon® E5-2673 v3 (Haswell) processor, which can reach up to a 3.2 GHz clock speed using Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0. These Virtual Machines are suitable for batch processing, Web servers, analysis and gaming programs, etc.
For persistent storage, please use the FS Virtual Machines, and purchase Premium Storage separately. The pricing and billing meters for the FS size are the same as for the F Series.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.

IP Address Options

Every cloud service option including one or multiple Azure Virtual Machines is automatically assigned a free dynamic virtual IP (VIP) address. For an additional fee, you can also get:

  • Instance-level public IP address:a dynamic public IP (PIP) address assigned to the Virtual Machine for direct access.
  • Reserved IP address: this may be a public IP address reserved for subscription, or used as a VIP address for any cloud service within the region.
  • Load-balanced IP address: other load-balanced VIP addresses could be assigned to cloud services that include one or multiple Azure Virtual Machines.
Learn about IP address pricing

FAQ

Expand all

Common

  • Is local disk storage billed separately?

    No. All new Virtual Machines have an OS disk and a local disk (also called the "resource disk"). We don't charge for local disk storage. The OS disk is charged at the common disk rate. Please refer to the configurations of all Virtual Machines.

  • What is a temporary disk?

    A temporary disk is storage that is attached directly to the deployed VM. Data on a temporary disk is lost once the VM is shut down. If you need persistent storage, there are a number of types and sizes of persistent data disks available that are charged separately. Please see thestorage pricing pagefor information. For persistent VM storage, we recommend that you use Managed Disks to take advantage of better management features, scalability, availability, and security.

  • Is there still a charge if the instances I deploy indicate "Stopped"?

    Maybe. If the status says "Stopped (Deallocated)," you're not being billed. If it says, "Stopped Allocated," you're still being billed for allocated virtual cores (not the software license itself). Full details on virtual machine states.

    Status Billed Details
    Starting Yes The initial starting state of virtual machines as they are going through the boot cycle. This period is billed as the virtual machines are running.
    Running (Started) Yes The running state of the virtual machine.
    Stopped Yes You are billed for allocated cores, but not software license.
    Note: To put a virtual machine in "Stopped" status, use the power option within the virtual machine, not from the Microsoft Azure classic portal.
    Deleted (Deallocated) No You are billed for allocated cores, but not software license.
    Note: To put a virtual machine in "Stopped" status, use the power option within the virtual machine, not from the Microsoft Azure classic portal.
  • Does the pricing of Virtual Machine instances include the storage cost associated with the running image?

    The pricing of the virtual machine includes only local disk storage. You can view the expenses of attaching Premium Disk (based on SSD) and Standard Disk (based on HDD) onto the VM on the Managed Disk pricing page.

  • How are A Series instances charged?

    In the past, all usage of A0, A2, A3 and A4 Standard and Basic virtual machines was issued as the fractions (A0) or multiples (A2, A3 and A4) of A1 virtual machines meter minutes. We've learned that this has caused some confusion for our customers, so we've made some changes to assign per-second usage to dedicated A0, A2, A3 and A4 meters. As a result, the resource GUIDs of A0, A2, A3 and A4 virtual machines may vary. If you have any billing routines rely on the resource GUIDs, you're required to modify them to take into consideration these new billing meters.

    Deployment Size Usage Emitted as Multiple of A1 Through January 10, 2016 Usage Emitted on Dedicated Meter as of January 11, 2016
    A0 0.25 A1 hours 1 A0 hours
    A2 2 A1 hours 1 A2 hours
    A3 4 A1 hours 1 A3 hours
    A4 8 A1 hours 1 A4 hours
  • If my virtual machine has run 6 minutes, 45 seconds, how much do I get billed?

    We charge you by the integral minutes of running the virtual machine, so you're not billed for any extra seconds. In this instance the charging is performed according to a usage time of 6 minutes.

  • What's an Internal Load Balancer?

    This is a new preview feature for Azure Virtual Machines with private IP address. The internally load-balanced endpoint is only accessible within a virtual network (for virtual machines within a virtual network) or cloud service (for virtual machines outside a virtual network). Internal load balancing is very useful for multi-tier applications where some of the application tiers aren't public facing yet require load balancing functionality.

  • How can I check that I have properly stopped a virtual machine and that I am not being billed for it?

    You may check the state of the virtual machine in the "Virtual Machine" tab, and in the virtual machine Dashboard. You are still being billed if the status of the virtual machine is "Stopped". No charging is performed only when the state is "Stopped (Deallocated)".

    To ensure there is no charge, please always stop virtual machines from the management portal. You can also stop the virtual machine through Powershell by calling ShutdownRoleOperation with "PostShutdownAction" equal to "StoppedDeallocated".

  • How am I charged for data transfers, if I have instances in two different regions?

    Each instance is charged for its data egress across regions.

  • Does the aforementioned pricing include tax?

    Yes, the pricing listed includes tax.

  • Can the server license be transferred to Azure and run on a virtual machine?

    Yes, if you have Software Assurance, you can "bring-your-own-license" for all virtual machines supported server products. through license mobility.

Windows Server

  • Do I need to provide my license key if I upload my local Windows Server image to Azure?

    No. Azure will provide the Windows Server license key for any running instance.

  • Can the license be transferred if I download Azure Windows Server image to my data center?

    No. You need to provide the license for this image.

SQL Server

  • When can I use Azure SQL Database? When can I use SQL Server?

    If you want to migrate existing applications or workloads into the cloud or expand some onpremise applications to the cloud, SQL Server in the virtual machine is the easiest option. If you want to build new relational applications, SQL Database may be an optimal long-term solution. No matter which of these two methods you adopt, you can use Azure to easily shift the applications between the on-site data center and the cloud according to the changing business requirements.

  • Which edition of SQL Server 2017 should I select?

    To help you make a selection, we provide a detailed features comparison.

  • Is there any difference from SQL Server Enterprise's DW edition?

    The installation, configuration and optimization of data warehouses (DW) represent typical complex workloads. You can improve the performance of these workloads through DW images specially optimized for Azure Virtual Machines, which could surpass at most 20% of the common SQL Server Enterprise virtual machine images. View the working principles.

  • Is it necessary to purchase a Windows virtual machine separately?

    No. The pricing in the table above is the total pricing of the Windows virtual machine and SQL Server.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need any help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

For all virtual machines deployed with two or more instances in the same availability set, we guarantee that you can have VM connection at least 99.95% of the time. For any single-instance virtual machine that uses Premium Storage for all disks, we guarantee that you can have VM connection at least 99.9% of the time. To learn more about the details of our Service Level Agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.

TextpageLeftNav.metaDescription: Learn more about the pricing details of Azure Virtual Machines. The Virtual Machines are divided into Windows, Linux and SQL Server. You can deploy Linux or Windows Virtual Servers in the cloud. Pay as you go without the need to pay in advance. A 1RMB Trial gets you ￥1,500 in service credits. You can also make a direct purchase and become an Azure Pay-in-Advance customer.
